document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

0F2EEBD8748E4D00A3EEDC50D5771D9D.description:
Accurately use general, academic, domain-specific, or content area words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career-readiness level. Demonstrate independence when
considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

45ABD8C19CCB4CAC806B89598FBC65E7.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking,
and listening at the college and career-readiness level.

6ECDEACD6A6F4084ABD01DA69AE48E11.description: Analyze the meaning of words with similar denotations and connotations.

C368A13073F34ADB80A139E5CEE59DBA.description:
Interpret figures of speech (e.g., oxymoron, hyperbole, paradox) in context and analyze
their role in the text.

091FAEB99E4B402D87CC4202B39EF070.description:
Identify, interpret, and integrate figurative language (including personification, similes,
and metaphors) appropriately into writing and speech.

E6EB4016AAEF49A5B9C24D2DACE2708A.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

400936D3641E42A7B7078D9A79B7C301.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

57D0B9E524144FE2A688A079342BA949.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauri), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning, part of
speech, origin, or standard usage/variations.

282834EF22F047F9838E5D65E7BB6237.description:
Identify and correctly use patterns of word modifications that indicate different meanings
or parts of speech (e.g., conceive, conception, conceivable).

DDB82E88DECA44B9B38546026AB0AD02.description:
Apply a variety of strategies to identify or clarify word use and help determine the
meaning of a word or phrase.

2E7450E0B90C4483B3CCD00E452438CE.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases through grade-level
appropriate reading and content, choosing flexibly from a variety of strategies.

FB738B14F35149209C270C0AE956BE86.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and
consulting reference materials.

9A984AEAB68142ABBE53A0132C5EB1E6.description: Use of comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs.

AE0BA0E239AC4C07B94359FCDE4A580A.description:
Use subject-verb agreement (compound subjects, indefinite pronouns, collective nouns,
inverted word order).

C94D0AECC5DC468EA7CACDEED8031FBD.description:
Use verbals (e.g., infinitives, participles, and gerunds used as adjectives and nouns) and modal auxiliaries (e.g., can, could, shall, should, will, would, must, have to, may, might,
ought to).

FE908BDB7EC14429B67367BAC4B26485.description:
Use verb tenses (e.g., simple present, present progressive, simple past, past progressive,
future, future progressive, and present perfect, including irregular verbs).

E05EAA7E86BB4E8C9487462CDB8B6FCD.description: Vary syntax for effect, consulting references for guidance as needed.

BA016AA5D87446D18D74F377EB22FE63.description:
Apply knowledge of language to understand how it functions in different contexts, to make effective choices in
terms of meaning or style, and comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

761FAA64F5334351890C738BC62391E8.description:
Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style, and
comprehension.

FA6DADBA0BCA456D87263C16B323C17C.description:
Use punctuation marks correctly, including the use of dashes and parentheses in
sentences.

E832E4F5F3194A539FFA145EAFA88DF1.description: Use advanced punctuation marks correctly (e.g., colon, semicolon).

4C4805F923E34BD088D4653E9999F2A9.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

27061BB210BF497987EF8C346F08BE1F.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

BFD14DE9B74E420EA7C432739F070092.description: Demonstrate knowledge of prepositions and prepositional phrases.

836BF34EC2F04B1BB6D58F91DFD4457D.description:
Apply an understanding of run-on sentences, complex and compound sentences, and sentence fragments. Assess various grammar and usage texts. Analyze subject-verb
agreement and parallel structure.

B05B35BEDFEA4B808F4D2DFED462D12A.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions when writing and speaking.

A5F45BC0C7C544DDBE9973D8FAD7E949.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

E2A7785201944F4D9E7AE5A7CF894D76.description: Write routinely for short and extended periods of time (e.g., for research, reflection, and revision) for a variety of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences (e.g., integrating technology or digital/print resources).

D4D4EE8333CB4DEE8A949C88CBC73EC0.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

E3578DEE1B99489CA61C7F9E5B26AF22.description: Interpret evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

14555A75927F449685ECDADBB27DA587.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

0E931ACDFA714269A659AF1A1D7E1934.description: Conduct sustained research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question) or solve a problem, relating multiple reliable sources and demonstrating understanding of the subject.

B8EC4DC50514434A94084B780985F27C.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

8CEB35362AB64E2E9F20AD8A0659DDC1.description: Use technology, including the internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products, utilizing technology’s capacity to link to other information and to display information flexibly and dynamically.

B387720201BC4D4BBDCADAF5C296028F.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others and produce and publish writing.

C011A924BF1D43D5A4AD494DFEB8AB36.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed through planning (e.g., outlines and graphic organizers), drafting, revising, editing (using editing marks), rewriting, and publishing, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed, avoiding plagiarism, considering style guides, and using citations (e.g., MLA and APA
student format).

5B470596F0A745BC82B329F08141F2E6.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting, and publishing).

8772AB84BB9F4D95A781B277B7125631.description:
Write narratives (e.g., short stories, memoirs, and journals) using transitional words and other cohesive devices
to better organize writing to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, targeted details, and well-structured sequences in 5 or more paragraphs.

1E29D89D07C34E7C9A5AADEDAF0CCB9B.description: Write literary texts to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

BDBD25D40C4E436AA5BD9BD5A87105C7.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

6973942D19A842269C10A2AB82A5CEB4.description: Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

9F595A65D3234F8DB5BA2D9ECA29F277.description: Introduce a topic or thesis statement. Organize ideas, concepts, and information.

7336BD7FDF6A4E1BB7008AEFEB49CFB5.description:
Write essays (e.g., argumentative, expository, compare and contrast, persuasive, and process), research papers, and film reviews with increasing independence and precision using appropriate text organization; an expanding vocabulary; and proper selection, organization, and analysis of content in 5 or more paragraphs 6 or more
sentences each.

9A175732DEF747E3838DA4DF91DFF148.description: Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

2FB303C29F274298A6A878BF3369DE78.description: Use reliable sources to demonstrate understanding of the topic or text.

F42235550A4F4D21ABAC7907179EF696.description: Support claim(s) or counterarguments with logical reasoning and relevant evidence.

A435489BA5B3452BA51A912006001002.description: Interpret, clarify, and defend viewpoints and opinions. Be able to state or justify arguments with support of the thesis statement and claims.

E27C74C575C74CCBB677EF9240F09FC3.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of grade-appropriate content, using valid reasoning and sufficient evidence in 5 or more paragraphs.

7E44F539BD204137A1468B7997C11593.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

BEE8294869364FAAA0C08F1F46624F3F.description:
Read and demonstrate comprehension of a variety of culturally relevant literature (e.g., stories, dramas, and
poetry) and informational texts (e.g., history, social studies, science, and technical texts) of appropriate complexity.

3874DA9D4BCC4331ADF0A506CE02989B.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

CFBB3AFA74C84B8DAD435C7D2FE072F8.description:
Analyze seminal or literary documents of historical significance and how they address
related themes and concepts.

B9D41113E2D7465A9175C00E529925C8.description: Analyze how an author draws on and transforms source material in a specific work.

D495255E15274378A51A54E3501724C6.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

E29B2D1E9DD1427CACDFE58C69CA94EE.description: Identify false statements and fallacious reasoning (including, but not limited to, narrative, persuasive, and descriptive writing and knowledge of their qualities).

C2719899BCBB41B18B50D3FC6978AE3C.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and sufficient.

D6091F5611AE4180BAF9BE48723D89F2.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

5B19539C3E4B4F7587F47E692903FC56.description: Analyze and critique the representation of a subject, character, or key scene as presented in two different media (print and multimedia), comparing which elements are emphasized or absent in each case.

B285CF6E3180468DAB17008E154309C1.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

E7825D5AAD2843CFAD714381C1A98BD2.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how an author uses
rhetoric to advance that point of view or purpose.

5D13969899BE4134A14866A4307A80E2.description: Analyze a particular point of view or cultural experience reflected in a work of literature from outside of Puerto Rico, drawing on a wide reading selection of world literature.

9CC8CA387E8240C2BB79EB92C820920B.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

346A1C7CF0BA428698B73851C288B140.description:
In detail, analyze how an author’s ideas or claims are developed and refined by particular
sentences, paragraphs, or portions of a text (e.g., chapters, essays, or news articles).

F76BC06F147E401E9CF62A158ABBE0AA.description:
Analyze how an author’s choices concerning how to structure a text, order events within it (e.g.,
parallel plots), and manipulate time (e.g., pacing, flashbacks) create effects such as mystery, tension, or surprise.

B25F3B8EF8E9482A91F74348469ADD81.description: Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections, chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

AEFBF8CD4C2E4E179E15EA8FD3F9593C.description: Analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the language of a court opinion differs from that of a newspaper).

041FB717B7F540418FBB56883E9E4D48.description: Determine figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

D6B1D6E3DAE94272A6703B16B48AF9D3.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in an informational text.

33ACF25B119B415A8774197A564234B8.description:
Analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the
language evokes a sense of time and place or how it sets a formal or informal tone).

14E2AA9FF76D4B08B2653F52BE08E272.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a literary text.

4FA145842AB24F5E9B126763CAE2BED9.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

D1BD268B8D4D4AE481870ABC64D3A9CC.description:
Analyze how an author presents an analysis or series of ideas or events in an informational text, including the order in which the points are made, how they are introduced and
developed, and the connections that are drawn between them.

EE6C28F5072F430ABC02999452C6B33C.description:
Analyze how complex characters (e.g., those with multiple or conflicting motivations) develop over the course of a literary text; interact with other characters; affect the setting, influence
the plot, and its components; or develop the theme.

CCEA934B682B4746B17EA4AE0C7F0E34.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

4236C7847B3F4B23ADB1157AFF98F2D6.description: Provide an objective summary of informational texts.

A5391894E5FC4173B6F7EA25BDE7D479.description:
Determine the theme or main idea of an informational text and analyze its development over the course of the text in detail, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by specific
details.

C247938B08754A36B3DD6C45F5D526D8.description: Provide a subjective or responsive summary of the text.

E30650FE062D403CBBC5392A997BC62D.description: Determine the theme or main idea of a literary text and analyze its development in detail, including how it emerges in the text and is shaped and refined by specific details.

BAFABC6A89D54B9385F6689D06502037.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

CB076EF2488045228049A1A41E277E07.description: Explain inferences and conclusions drawn from texts to support analysis.

396F2C669322498D9243BC83C5053E4B.description: Determine and explain fact/ details that support main idea(s) from the texts.

BED720D4683443A787FCDF905611A44F.description: Distinguish and explain fiction vs. nonfiction.

03F12B6C9E1642B2B6410B115C28F4E4.description: Distinguish and explain fact vs. opinion.

22ACFB8661834CED9313BC0DD30AD345.description:
Evaluate, analyze, research/synthesize drawn from in-depth critical reading of appropriate texts and viewing of multimedia resources. Interpret increasingly complex phenomena, ideas, processes, genres, and relationships
within and across texts.

534564A9854140B8A3048DA7FECB1B66.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text.

5D9DEBDFA7EC4137A8DB4EE0C275E819.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

6D964AE0D81B4A60AAB2A82A054B9EC7.description:
Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with appropriate purpose, intonation, expression,
and understanding.

D9C7DD65162A4417ADEAFF13ED342FF0.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

5AEB0729078D4FE680B5165F423C513C.description: Accurately read grade-level texts automatically with appropriate patterns of stress, intonation, or expression.

20CA5AA9EC60445AA048F4B936187972.description:
Process encoding sounds through letters (s, r), consonant blends (sh, sk), digraphs (ay, ew), or
trigraphs (sch, thr) using conventional spelling patterns to form words.

B93FBE4DACC94C63990C7D1AAFF711EA.description: Apply meaning to single units of sound in existing word parts to encode a given word.

2F4538704218400EA3C2BE16312E1A3D.description:
Accurately read multisyllabic words using a combined knowledge of all letter-sound
correspondences, syllabication patterns, prefixes, and suffixes.

B537255CEF174EBE8BCDF786E214E55F.description:
Use a combined knowledge of strategies to encode grade-level monosyllabic and multisyllabic
words.

23F497EDEA2E4D0BAE8DFA5EB035E4CC.description: Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode and encode words. (

18C3DDF3A1D84DA1A44445FBFB433CF5.description: Refer to previous grades to reinforce these skills if necessary.

84ED61F2BCF245E59694291E97D21719.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

8819FD1C7D364FB0ADA0CBCC573BA3F8.description:
Produce complete complex and compound sentences, recognizing and correcting
inappropriate run-ons and fragments.

8497AD669CFB4FE3A4EEF215DD4E833A.description:
Understand that ideas are connected through cohesive devices and larger, meaningful chunks
of text.

583FC83BA9F2448E88B1B6BD9DE53A01.description:
Provide complex reference information of source(s) applying required MLA and APA student
format.

013C0813ADB44DABBABCE6B05360FA99.description:
Cite or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others avoiding plagiarism and following a
standard format for citation (e.g., MLA and APA student format).

0A8C68305FA945BC8BB9B8DE58182EFC.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources to assess the credibility of
each source.

7663E1ED5FE24EF9909185D32B957B2E.description: Recognize relevant information from multiple reliable print and digital sources.

9E74D2B89296447093FCF852B5294922.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

E3A8D753B50E4C89B185369568D96729.description: Plan and deliver a variety of oral presentations and reports on social, academic, college, and career topics that present evidence and facts to support ideas using a growing understanding of formal and informal registers (e.g., integrating technology or digital/print resources).

01176AC3C8324593A0C366C63227F7C3.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

CB43D88F1AC3435BA6B395296714C1D3.description:
Make predictions and inferences and draw conclusions from listening to a variety of texts,
performances, and multimedia sources.

B6FB74D51F6D4EFF8AEEA5B997A36C8F.description:
Express thoughts and opinions when discussing current events, concepts, themes,
characters, plot, and conflict resolution.

D2F5E7604F5A4B7287B8D8D514EA5B92.description:
Adjust language choices according to the context, purpose, task, and audience participating in class and group
discussions.

F11AE8FAE785477D9A1511FF12B9C477.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

2062B41C78E642EC809AAB0318309FA3.description: Negotiate with and persuade others in discussions and conversations using acquired vocabulary and open responses to express and defend different opinions.

513531FAD3AD48D6B6856C1BDB66D789.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions through speech.

E1E481F5E1C146E6AA7DDF86383A130E.description:
Accurately and appropriately use a variety of grade‐appropriate general, academic, and content‐specific
academic, social, college, and career vocabulary to produce complex spoken language and to tell, retell, explain,
and analyze stories, personal experiences, and current/world events.

587E549DD9CB4DA69310F0B92ED1F97B.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

71AAA18985FC4833811FE0889A225CBA.description:
Assess, review, and debate information, justifying answers with details from texts, the self,
and the world.

0988037309CF4815B51CD8613B15C76F.description: Listen to, discuss, respond to, and provide complex instructions and information.

7BA353984CD64F07BDCF0441A20989D9.description: Respond orally to closed- and open-ended questions.

E57B1B38D113480ABE731DB7BE295728.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

9D3F1D32B8B34E3C8A2C603E21252CE5.description:
Contribute to class, group, and partner discussions, sustaining conversations on a variety of appropriate and
relevant academic, social, college, and career topics by following turn‐taking rules and asking and answering on‐ topic questions. React to others with relevant information by paraphrasing, evaluating, analyzing, and synthesizing ideas.

6E3376A85D9643649B99DEAF67AB8C5D.description: Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college and career topics in diverse contexts and with different audiences.

FC6CA16E0CB442789DA26F9B1041F242.description:
Listen and respond to be able to describe, support, and discuss information; answer and formulate closed- and open-ended questions; and listen to, classify, and prioritize
information.

CF3FE17D082E4407ACCF80924CE9ABF0.description:
Listen and respond during read-alouds, presentations, or performances from a variety of literature, periods, genres, and styles to interpret character development and setting and to
connect to the text by identifying the tone, voice, and mood.

126E5CB9913B4D98BB925D8D6EDDFE94.description:
Take turns; ask/answer relevant questions; affirm others; add relevant information; relate
the information to prior knowledge from experience, texts, or real-world connections; paraphrase and analyze key ideas.

B58514143F8D4499983451766EA1E126.description:
Demonstrate comprehension of oral presentations and discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics by asking and answering questions that show
thoughtful consideration and extension of the ideas or arguments.

1D045181DE5B42019E73140BBDF70164.description:
Listen, support discussions, and interact with peers during read-alouds (of fictional and informational texts), oral
presentations; and class, group, and partner discussions on a variety of grade‐appropriate academic, social,
college, and career topics.

8747655921B74447A5BF5A16732DBBA9.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.
